tool.name: OTB.DEMConvert
tool.description: Converts a geo-referenced DEM image into a general raster file compatible with OTB DEM handling.
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.DEMConvert in $in prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: in
param.label: Input geo-referenced DEM to convert to general raster format.
param.help: Input geo-referenced DEM to convert to general raster format. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, jpeg, png

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_out
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: In order to be understood by the Orfeo ToolBox and the underlying OSSIM library, a geo-referenced Digital Elevation Model image can be converted into a general raster image, which consists in 3 files with the following extensions: .ras, .geom and .omd. Once converted, you have to place these files in a separate directory, and you can then use this directory to set the "DEM Directory" parameter of a DEM based OTB application or filter.
